sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RAVINE a deep, narrow gorge, cleft or valley in a mountain, worn by the violent rush of water, whence the name, which comes through Fr. from Lat. rapina, violent robbery or plunder (rapere, to seize). The doublet “ ravin ” or “ raven,” robbery, greed, has given place to the more learned form “rapine,’’ but is still seen in “ ravenous,’’ greedy, voracious.
